resources.string:
• Patient Name: John Doe
 • Age: 45
 • Gender: Male
 • Occupation: Office worker
 • Contact Information: 0111111

• Low back pain radiating down the right leg to the calf (sciatica) for the past 2 weeks.
 • Pain is sharp and stabbing, worse with sitting and bending forward, improves with lying down.
 • Difficulty standing from a seated position due to pain.
 • No recent trauma or injury.

• Previous history of lumbar disc herniation 5 years ago, treated conservatively with physiotherapy and medication.
 • No other major medical conditions or surgeries.
 • Medications: Lisinopril for hypertension.

• Reduce pain and inflammation in the lower back.
 • Improve range of motion and flexibility in the lumbar spine.
 • Improve functional mobility and ability to perform daily activities.
